prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
['That night, I was up at the top of Mt. Poniponi', 'A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world.']
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I saw their shadowy silhouettes, projected against the ritual curtain!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: She was just a shadow, but I could tell it was the accused, reverse-gripping that dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. So the user is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. They want just one pair.

First, I need to go through all the testimonies and see what each person is claiming. The testimonies are from Ihmus. Testimony 0 says they saw shadowy silhouettes on the ritual curtain. Testimony 1 says the figures were created by the light of the full moon on a clear night. Testimony 2 claims it was the accused holding the dagger in a reverse grip.

Now looking at the evidences. Let me check Evidence 1: Rites Guide. It mentions that during the Purification Rite, there's a curtain around the sanctum (Evidence 4 also mentions the ritual curtain). The Rites Guide also says that the Purification Rite starts when the moon is over Mt. Poniponi. The testimony 1 says the figures were made by the full moon's light on a clear night. But wait, the Rites Guide says the rite begins when the moon is over the mountain. However, Evidence 2, the May 9th Newspaper, has a weather forecast that says there's a cold front moving in overnight. Wait, but the testimony 1 says it was a clear and still night. The newspaper's weather forecast for the day mentions calm and clear skies during the day, but a cold front moving in overnight. So if the rite happened at night when the moon was over the mountain, perhaps the cold front had already arrived, causing cloudy skies. If the moon was out, then the skies would be clear, but the forecast says the cold front would come overnight. The timing is important here. The rite starts when the moon is over the mountain, which would be at night. But the newspaper says the cold front comes overnight, so maybe during the rite, the skies were still clear, but the testimony says the full moon's light created the shadows. Wait, the newspaper's weather forecast says that the area around the Inner Sanctum will have calm, clear skies today (the day of the rite), but a cold front moves in overnight. So the rite happens during the day? Wait no, the Purification Rite starts when the moon is over Mt. Poniponi, which would be at night. But the newspaper says that the cold front comes overnight. So if the rite is happening at night, maybe during the rite, the cold front hasn't arrived yet. Wait, the newspaper says the cold front moves in overnight. The day of the rite is May 9th. The newspaper is from the morning of the 9th, and the rite is that day. So the rite would start at night when the moon is over the mountain. The cold front is coming overnight, which would be after the rite has started. So maybe during the time the shadows were seen, the sky was clear, allowing the full moon's light. But then the cold front arrives later. So maybe Testimony 1's claim about the full moon's light is possible. Wait, but perhaps the contradiction is between Testimony 1 and Evidence 2's mention of the cold front. If the testimony says the figures were created by the full moon's light on a clear night, but Evidence 2's newspaper says that the cold front moved in overnight, which could mean clouds, making the moonlight not visible. But the timing here is tricky. The newspaper says "overnight," which might be after the rite had already started. So if the rite started on the night of the 9th, which is when the moon is over the mountain, then during the rite, the skies were clear (as the day was clear), but the cold front came later that night. So during the time the shadows were seen, the moon was out. Therefore, no contradiction. Hmm.

Alternatively, maybe looking at Evidence 4: Ritual Curtain. The curtain was shut during the rite, so how could the shadows be projected on it from outside? Wait, the testimony says the silhouettes were projected against the curtain. But if the curtain is enclosing the sanctum, then the light source would have to be inside the sanctum. But Testimony 1 says the light was from the full moon, which would be outside. So if the curtain is closed, the moonlight outside wouldn't cast shadows from inside onto the curtain. Wait, that's a possible contradiction. Let me think again. If the sanctum is surrounded by the ritual curtain, which is closed, then the only light sources inside would be the lantern (Evidence 7 mentions a lantern with broken wind guard). If the light was from inside, then the shadows would be from inside. But the Testimony 1 claims the figures were created by the full moon's light. If the moonlight is outside, and the curtain is closed, then the moonlight can't enter to project shadows. So the testimony that the figures were created by the full moon's light contradicts the fact that the curtain was closed, which would block external light. Therefore, Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain) says the entrance was shut during the rite, meaning the curtain was closed. Testimony 1 says the figures were made by the full moon's light. But if the curtain was closed, the moonlight couldn't penetrate to cast shadows on the curtain. So the light must have come from inside, like the lantern. Therefore, Testimony 1's claim about the moon's light contradicts Evidence 4. Wait, but Evidence 1 (Rites Guide) mentions that the curtain is around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it. So the curtain is surrounding the sanctum, and the entrance was shut. Therefore, the light from outside (the moon) can't get in. Therefore, Testimony 1's statement that the shadows were made by the moonlight is contradicted by Evidence 4. That would be a valid contradiction.

Alternatively, maybe Evidence 11: Mountain Range Poster shows Mt. Poniponi is 2298m and the Inner Sanctum is 2310m. The moon needs to be over Mt. Poniponi's summit for the rite to start. But the moon's position would cast shadows in a certain direction. Maybe the direction of the light? Not sure. Maybe that's not the contradiction.

Looking back, the key contradiction is between Testimony 1 (moonlight creating the shadows) and Evidence 4 (curtain closed), because the moonlight outside can't cast shadows on the curtain if the curtain is closed and blocking external light. So that's a solid contradiction. Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain) and Testimony 1.

Wait, but the user wants the evidence and testimony numbers. Let me check:

Testimonies are 0,1,2. Testimony 1 is the one about the full moon's light. Evidence 4 is the Ritual Curtain. So the answer would be {"evidence":4, "testimony":1}.

{"evidence": 4, "testimony": 1}
